message.content:
cs.CV, cs.SI, cs.HC, cs.MM, cs.RO

The paper describes an Augmented Reality (AR) system designed to guide the needle insertion process for irreversible electroporation (IRE) in the pancreas. This involves tracking the position of the headset, needle electrodes, and ultrasound (US) probe in space and rendering real-time holographic guides on the HoloLens. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) as it involves tracking and rendering visual guides. The paper also involves human-computer interaction (HCI) and medical imaging (MM), making cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction), and cs.MM (Multimedia) likely sub-categories. Additionally, the use of needle insertion and tracking can be related to robotics (RO), making it a possible sub-category as well.
